title: Barman saved 35 passengers when coach driver collapsed
text:
A quick thinking barman took the wheel of a coach after the driver collapsed.
Stuart Bateman from Darlington saved the lives of 35 people who were onboard at the time.
The 37-year-old said he was woken up by screams of fellow passengers, as the National Holiday coach bolted at 55mph on the M62.
Stuart, who works in Weatherspoon's says it was natural instinct to grab the wheel.
It's a whirlwind, it feels so surreal. Me and my girlfriend were on a day out to Liverpool. On the way back, we dozed off.
We woke up to screaming. The driver was slumped over the wheel.
I was startled.
I took my belt off, grabbed the wheel and tried to steer the coach straight.
The atmosphere at the front of the coach was just sheer shock.
It's surreal thinking about it. Looking back, thinking what could have happened."
– Stuart Bateman Mr Bateman also knelt down to take the unconscious bus drivers foot from the accelerator of the coach, before guiding it to verge out of the way.
Thanks to the actions of Stuart, a major crash was avoided.
The coach scraped crash barriers and was clipped by another car as another passenger rushed to help.
National Holiday thanked Mr Bateman for acting so quickly in the moment.
The bus driver who collapsed is now recovering from a virus.
Last updated Tue 7 Feb 2017 Darlington County Durham
